intro: Siparuna rionegrensis, commonly known as the Rio Negro siparuna, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in the humid and shaded conditions of the rainforest. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of the Amazonian ecosystem.
